start.instructions: Please follow this wizard to obtain an individual configuration bundle for your printer
start.original: If you are using a printer that was originally shipped with RepRapFirmware, you can select a predefined template here:
start.contributed: The following machine templates were contributed by users and have not been throughly tested:
start.alternative: Alternatively, you can create your own individual configuration by creating a new one from scratch or by loading an existing JSON template:
start.title: Start
start.note: Note: If you encounter problems, please report your problems on
start.options: Some configuration options may not be available yet. In this case please refer to the
start.webapp: This web app is fully open-source and licensed under the terms of the

general.title: General
general.boardDescription: Board on which the firmware runs
general.versionDescription: Version of the firmware running on your board
general.printerNameDescription: Name of your printer (M550). If you use mDNS, you can access your printer via Myprinter.local
general.sbcDescription: Run RepRapFirmware in stand-alone mode without an attached single-board computer
general.sbc: Run in standalone mode without SBC
general.M501Description: Load saved configuration parameters on start-up (M501)
general.M501: Read config-override.g file at end of startup process (provides similar functionality to the EEPROM option in Marlin)
general.M911Description: Store the last valid print parameters on the SD card when a power failure occurs (M911)
general.M911: Save print state on power failure
general.autoGCode: G-Codes to run when Auto-Saving is performed:
general.autoImportant: Important: The file /sys/resurrect-prologue.g must be set up manually for resume to work (see
general.cartesian: This machine uses individual motors to drives each axis
general.coreXY: This machine uses coupled motors to position the nozzle on the XY plane
general.coreXZ: This machine uses coupled motors to position the nozzle on the XZ plane
general.delta: This machine uses towers to position the nozzle
general.deltaRadiusDescription: Horizontal distance subtended by each rod, measured between joint centres, when the effector is in the centre
general.rodLengthDescription: Distance between the centre of your towers and the joint at the effector
general.homedHeightDescription: Maximum build height of your printer
general.maximumTravelDescription: Maximum travel length in Z direction
general.homingFPDescription: Homing is performed in two stages. First pass means the initial homing run
general.homingSPDesription: Second pass means the second homing run after the endstops were triggered for the first time
general.travelSpeedDescription: Speed for travel moves during homing
general.diveHeightDescription: Z lift amount for bed probing and for cartesian homing files
general.deltaReduced: Reduce homing speed. Recommended for initial calibration
general.extraM558: Generate an extra M558 code in config.g that you can remove after initial calibration
general.duet06Question: Is your Duet 0.6 board marked with a note saying 4.7K or was it shipped with an original RepRapPro Ormerod 2?
general.duet06Note: Note: Older Duet 0.6 boards use 1 kΩ series resistors.
general.xMinDescription: Distance between the low X axis end and the bed corner
general.xMaxDescription: Maximum length of the X axis plus X minimum
general.yMinDescription: Distance between the low Y axis end and the bed corner
general.yMaxDescription: Maximum length of the Y axis plus Y minimum

row.warningText: Your specified motor current exceeds the safe range. You may have to use extra cooling to prevent damage of your stepper drivers!

endstops.title: Endstop | Endstops
endstops.endstopConfigurationNoteText: When an endstop is hit, the axis position will be set to the corresponding axis minimum/maximum. If your endstop switch is not mounted at the axis end, you will have to add an extra G92 code after the homing move (G1..S1) to your homing files in order to set the new axis position. When homing the Z axis using a Z probe, the firmware will set the new Z position to the specified trigger height
endstops.switchDescription: Endstop switch pulls signal from GND to +3.3V when triggered (normally-closed switch)
endstops.activeLowDescription: Endstop switch pulls signal from +3.3V to GND when triggered (normally-open switch)
endstops.sensorlessDescription: Motor stall detection of the stepper drivers
endstops.sensorlessNoteText: Sensorless homing via motor stall detection requires extra configuration steps. See
endstops.probeXOffsetDescription: Offset of the Z-probe in X direction
endstops.probeYOffsetDescription: Offset of the Z-probe in Y direction
endstops.probeSpeedDescription: Speed at which bed points are probed
endstops.deployDescription: Deploy or retract a mechanical probe by running macro files
endstops.noprobeDescription: No Z-probe is installed. The distance between the nozzle and the bed must be manually determined.
endstops.switchProbeDescription: A switch is used to determine the distance between nozzle and bed.
endstops.switchNote3: If you are not using an active-high switch, you have to invert the Z-probe port on the
endstops.deltaWarning: This switch must be connected to the E0 endstop terminal!
endstops.deltaWarning3: This switch must be connected to the Z probe terminal and
endstops.deltaWarning32: to the Z endstop switch terminal!
endstops.unmodulatedDescription: An umodulated Z-probe is used to determine the distance between nozzle and bed (without trigger signal)
endstops.modulatedDescription: A modulated Z-probe is used to determine the distance between nozzle and bed (with trigger signal)
endstops.recoveryTimeDescription: Recovery time of the smart effector/piezo
endstops.servoDescription: PWM channel to control the BLTouch probe with
endstops.bltouchNote: Use a BLTouch for Z-probing (also see
endstops.bltouchNote1: Make sure you change it to use +3.3V instead of +5V before you connect it or you risk damaging your board!
endstops.pwmNote: You must specify an input and a PWM control pin on the
endstops.pwmNote1: page if you want to configure a BLTouch probe.
endstops.triggerHeightDescription: Height of the nozzle(s) when the probe is triggered

heaters.title: Heater | Heaters
heaters.bedOutputDescription: Output channel for the heated bed
heaters.bedControlDescription: Control method for the bed heater
heaters.bedNozzle: Assign Bed Heater to First Nozzle
heaters.bedNozzleDescription: Check this if you want to connect the first nozzle heater to the hot bed terminal
heaters.chamberOutputDescription: Output channel for the heated chamber
heaters.chamberControlDescription: Control method for the chamber heater
heaters.tempLimitDescription: Maximum allowed temperature of this heater before a temperature fault is raised
heaters.pwmLimitDescription: Final PID heater scale factor. You can change this to compensate voltage and heater resistance parameters
heaters.coefficient: C coefficient of the Steinhart-Hart equation. May be used to improve the β model parameters too
heaters.channel: Assigned sensor channel for this heater

fans.title: Fan | Fans
fans.name: Name
fans.speedDescription: Initial value of this fan when turned on
fans.invertedDescription: Invert fan PWM signal (required for 4-pin PWM cooling fans)
fans.frequencyDescription: PWM frequency of this fan. 500Hz works well for normal fans, use 25kHz for 4-pin PWM cooling fans
fans.thermostaticDescription: Enable thermostatic control for this fan
fans.monitoredHeatersDescription: Heaters to monitor for thermostatic control
fans.triggerTempDescription: Temperature at which the thermostatically-controlled fan is activated

tools.title: Tool | Tools
tools.M116: Wait for Temperatures to be Reached on Tool Change
tools.M116Description: Generate an M116 code in the tpost macros
tools.tcode: Select the First Tool on Start-Up
tools.tcodeDescription: A T-code with the first tool number is generated at the end of config.g

compensation.title: Compensation
compensation.noteText: 3/4/5 Point Bed Compensation is deprecated. It has been replaced with the new Mesh Bed Compensation.
compensation.numCaliDescription: Number of adjustment factors used for auto-calibration
compensation.radiusDescription: Radius of the outer probe points
compensation.homeDescription: Home all towers in bed.g before any points are probed
compensation.mesh: Bed Probing for Mesh Bed Compensation
compensation.xMinDescription: Minimum X coordinate of the probe points
compensation.xMaxDescription: Maximum X coordinate of the probe points
compensation.yMinDescription: Minimum Y coordinate of the probe points
compensation.yMaxDescription: Maximum Y coordinate of the probe points
compensation.orthDescription: Check this to enable orthogonal axis compensation via M556
compensation.measuredDescription: Height of the deviations measured for orthogonal axis compensation

display.title: Display
display.12864Description: Check this to enable support for an external 12864 display
display.encoderDescription: Number of pulses generated by the rotary encoder per detent
display.menuName: Please enter the Name for the new Menu:

network.title: Network
network.enableDescription: Check this to enable networking features (M552 S1)
network.password: Password for the web interface (HTTP), FTP, and Telnet:
network.passwordDescription: Optional password to protect your printer from others on your local network (M551)
network.wifiNameDescription: Name of the SSID to connect to. Alternatively, you can connect manually via M587
network.macDescription: MAC address of your machine. This is normally auto-generated
network.dhcp: Acquire Dynamic IP Address via DHCP
network.dhcpDescription: Use DHCP to acquire a dynamic IP configuration from your router (M552)
network.ipDescription: Static IP address of your printer (M552). This value should be unique on your local network
network.gatewayDescription: This should be the router's IP address on your local network (M554)
network.http: Enable HTTP (required for the web interface)
network.httpDescription: Enable HyperText Transmission Protocol to provide access to the web interface
network.ftpDescription: Enable File Transmission Protocol. Be aware that RepRapFirmware only supports one concurrent connection!
network.telnetDescription: Enable Telnet. Be aware that RepRapFirmware only supports one concurrent connection!

finish.title: Finish
finish.dwc: Get the latest stable Duet Web Control version
finish.reprap: Get the latest stable RepRapFirmware version
finish.gcodes: Full list of all available G-codes

app.pageErrorFix: Please fix them before you continue.
app.configErrorFix: Check the I/O Mapping page before you continue.
app.configInstructions: Put the RepRapFirmware files in the /sys directory and extract Duet Web Control bundle to the /www directory of your SD card. If you are using Duet Web Control, upload those files on the Settings page.
app.individual: The following system files will be generated:
app.dwc: If you are using Duet Web Control, you can upload the ZIP file(s)
app.dwc2: on the Settings page. Otherwise you can extract the contents of this configuration bundle directly to the root of your SD card.
app.dwc5: for further information about the purpose of these files.
app.zip: Download configuration bundle as ZIP file

thermistor.resistance: Measure the resistances of your thermistor at three different temperatures and enter your values below:
